newsitem.title: USA: EDS wins part of $300 mln military pact. [corrected 08:26 gmt 28/9]
newsitem.headline: EDS wins part of $300 mln military pact. [corrected 08:26 gmt 28/9]

text.p: Electronic Data Systems Corp said on Friday that it was one of four companies to participate in a a five-year military financial services contract valued at a total estimated $300 million. (Corrects to show EDS is not the sole winner of the contract and that contract is not definitely worth $300 million.)
EDS said in a statement it won the contract from the Defense Finance and Accounting Service.
CSC Computer Science SA, Lockheed Martin Corp and Boeing Co were also participants, EDS said.
EDS said it could not estimate how much it would earn from the contract.
Under the agreement, EDS said it would provide software and related services to the agency's Indiana-based Financial Systems Organization.
EDS said it had been a partner with the Defense Finance and Accounting Service since it was formed in 1991 and that this was its second contract with them.
